purpleculture_pinyin:
tuó
hump or hunchbacked; camel
горбатый или горбатый; верблюд
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 駝)
Pictophonetic: 它 indicates the sound; 马 (horse) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
驼背 [ tuó bèi ]: hunchbacked; stooping; hunchback
驼色 [ tuó sè ]: light tan (color); camel-hair color
单峰驼 [ dān fēng tuó ]: dromedary
驼子 [ tuó zi ]: hunchback
驼鹿 [ tuó lù ]: elk; moose

heisig_chinese_memo: From afar it might look like a horse, but when it comes closer you see the humps and realize it's a camel (back end).
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: It's not a horse, but Saudi's use camel (back end) for transportation the same way cowboys use horses.

驼字的基本解释

驼
（駝）
tuó
指“骆驼”：驼峰（骆驼背部高起的肉峰）。驼毛。驼铃。双峰驼。
身体前曲，背脊突起像驼峰：驼背。

驼字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuó］
［《廣韻》徒河切，平歌，定。］
“驼1”的繁体字。亦作“馳2”。亦作“駞1”。
(1)骆驼。
(2)脊背弯曲如驼峰。
(3)通“馱”。背负；驮负。
(4)引申为负债，欠帐。
(5)通“坨”。成块的东西。
(6)方言。取物。
(7)量词。相当于坨、块。
[②]［chí］
同“馳1”。

驼字的英文翻译

◎ 驼
camel, crookback, humpback

驼字的康熙字典解释

【亥集上】【馬字部】　駝； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1447第24
【廣韻】徒何切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】唐何切，?音陀。【玉篇】駱駝也。一作馲駝。【前漢·西域傳】鄯善國多馲駝。【註】師古曰：脊上肉鞍，隆高若封上，俗呼封牛。或曰駝狀似馬，頭似羊，長項，垂耳，有蒼褐黃紫數色，性耐寒惡熱，夏至退毛至盡。人欲載，輒屈足受之。自燉煌往外國，流沙千餘里，無水，有伏流，駝遇其處，停不進，以足跑地，掘之，常得水。又靑海北，夏有?風，傷行旅，風將至，駝先引頸鳴，以鼻口匿沙中，人見之，則以氊擁蔽口面，避其患，其臥腹不帖地，屈足，糞煙直上如狼煙。亦名橐駝。【古諺】少所見，多所怪，見橐駝，以爲馬腫背。又【唐制】驛置有明駝使，非邊塞軍機，不得擅發。俗本改明作鳴，非。　又通作它。【揚雄·長楊賦】敺橐它。　又背僂也。【柳宗元·郭橐駝種樹傳註】人背駝不能仰也。或作他。【莊子·德充符】衞有惡人哀駘它。【註】它與駝同，言背僂也。　又凡以畜負物曰駝。或作佗。【前漢·趙充國傳】以一馬自佗負。別作駞。【李白詩】吳姬十五細馬駞。

驼字的源字形

驼字的起名意思

表示与马相类的动物。骆驼。也指人身体背部向后成拱形的。

camel
Basic explanation of words
camel
(camel)
tuó
Refers to "camel": the hump (the hump of a camel rising from the back). Camel hair. Camel bell. Bactrian camel.
The body is bent forward, and the back protrudes like a hump: a hump.
camel
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tuó］
["Guangyun" Tu Heqi, Ping Ge, Ding. ]
The traditional characters of "驼1". Also known as "Chi 2". Also known as "駞1".
(1) Camel.
(2) The back is curved like a hump.
(3) Through "tuo". Carry on one's back
(4) Explained to be debts, debts in arrears.
(5) Through "tuo". Things in chunks.
(6) Dialects. Fetch.
(7) Quantifiers. It is equivalent to tuo and block.
[②]［chí］
Same as "Chi 1".
camel

◎ Camel
camel, crookback, humpback
camel
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
【Haiji 1】【Horse Character Department】　 camel; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 1447 24
[Guang Yun] Disciple He Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Tang He Qi,? Yin Tuo. [Jade articles] camels too. A llama. [Pre-Han · Western Regions Biography] Shanshan has many camels. [Note] Shigu said: The meat saddle on the spine, if the long high is sealed, it is commonly called the bull. Or the camel looks like a horse, the head looks like a sheep, a long neck, lop-eared, pale brown, yellow, purple and several colors. It is resistant to cold and heat, and the hair fades to the end of the summer solstice. People want to be loaded, but no matter how bad they are. From Xiehuang to a foreign country, there is more than a thousand li of quicksand, no water, there is a low current, the camel meets it, and can't stop, run with its feet, dig it, and often get water. In the north of the sea, there is wind in the summer, hurting the traveling, and the wind is approaching. The camel will scream in the neck first, hide in the sand with the nose and mouth, and when people see it, they will cover their mouth and face, avoid their troubles, and lie down on the ground. , Bent the feet, the dung smoke straight up like wolf smoke. Also known as a camel. [Ancient proverb] Seeing less, but more strange. Seeing a camel, you think that a horse has a swollen back. Also [Tang Dynasty] The post has a camel ambassador, not a frontier military plane, and it is not allowed to send it without permission. The common version is changed to Ming as Ming, not.　Through it again. [Yang Xiong·Chang Yang Fu] Drive it away.　Back again. [Notes on Liu Zongyuan·Guo Li's Camel Planting Tree] People can’t look back on their backs. Or be him. [Zhuangzi·De Chong Fu] Wei You wicked people mourn it. [Note] It's the same as the camel, but it's back.　Everything is called a camel by the animal's burden. Or as Tuo. [Previous Han·Zhao Chongguo Biography] Lose yourself with one horse. Don't be a chariot. 【Li Bai Poems】Wu Ji's fifteen thin horses. camel
Source glyph
camel
Name meaning
Indicates animals similar to horses. camel. It also refers to the arched back of the back of the body.
驼
形声字。馬(马)表意,其古文字形体像一匹马,表示骆驼是有些像马的动物:佗(tu6)省声,佗通驮,表示骆驼是沙漠
中负重的动物。形旁简化。本义是骆驼。
①骆驼:~绒「单峰~|双峰~。②(背)弯曲:~背。

верблюд
Пиктофонетические символы.
Лошадь (лошадь) означает, что его древние символы напоминают лошадь, что указывает на то, что верблюд - это животное, похожее на лошадь: Туо (tu6) - это провинциальный звук, Tuo Tongtuo, означающий, что верблюд - тяжеловесное животное в пустыне.
